intro: Taraktogenos gracilis, commonly known as the slender glasswort, is a halophytic plant native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean. It thrives in saline environments, such as salt marshes and tidal flats, due to its ability to tolerate high salt concentrations. The plant has succulent, fleshy leaves that store water, aiding in survival in arid conditions. Its small, greenish flowers are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Taraktogenos gracilis plays a role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various small organisms.
